segments.en: Hello, everyone, and welcome to EnglishPod.
My name is Marco.
My name is Catherine.
And today we're talking about going out for a drink.
segments.cn: 今天我们要讨论的是出去喝一杯。

segments.en: That's right, we're going to a bar and we're going to order cocktails.
segments.cn: 没错，我们要去酒吧点鸡尾酒。

segments.en: So we're going to learn all about the different types of cocktails and a little bit more language that you can use at a bar.
segments.cn: 所以我们将学习各种鸡尾酒的类型，以及一些你可以在酒吧使用的语言。

segments.en: Exactly.
So let's take a listen to today's dialogue.
segments.cn: 现在让我们来听今天的对话。

segments.en: We'll be back in a moment.
What can I get you?
I'll have a Cosmo, please.
Dude, you can't order a Cosmo.
That's a lady's drink.
You're embarrassing me.
What are you talking about?
It's a good drink.
It's too soft.
Order something with a little more kick to it.
Fine.
I'll have a sex on the beach.
segments.cn: 我来一杯Sex on the Beach。

segments.en: You have got to be kidding me.
Come on, it's delicious, especially when served with a pineapple or a coconut.
segments.cn: 来吧，这很好喝，尤其是配上菠萝或椰子。

segments.en: Forget it.
I'm ordering for you.
I'll have a scotch on the rocks and my friend here will have a Manhattan.
segments.cn: 我来一杯加冰的苏格兰威士忌，我的朋友来一杯曼哈顿。

segments.en: Put it on my tab.
Here.
Now this is a real drink.
It's strong.
This is going to get me wasted.
That's the idea.
All right, we're back.
So now let's take a look at some of those drinks on Language Takeaway.
segments.cn: 现在让我们看看Language Takeaway中的一些饮料。

segments.en: Language Takeaway.
So in Language Takeaway today, we're going to focus on the names of drinks.
segments.cn: 今天的Language Takeaway，我们将专注于饮料的名称。

segments.en: So we heard four of them in today's dialogue.
segments.cn: 我们在今天的对话中听到了四种。

segments.en: What was that first one, Marco?
The first one was a Cosmo, or also called a Cosmopolitan.
Okay, so this is something if you watch the TV show Sex in the City, you will have heard before because the girls always order cosmos.
segments.cn: 好的，如果你看过《欲望都市》，你会听说过，因为女孩们总是点Cosmo。

segments.en: Now, a Cosmopolitan is served in a Martini glass, right?
segments.cn: Cosmopolitan是用马提尼杯盛的，对吧？

segments.en: Right, you've seen the Martini glass.
It kind of looks like a triangle.
And it's very easy to spill.
Yeah, that's right.
So what does a Cosmo have?
Because obviously, a cocktail is a combination of different liquors or alcohol with maybe juices and stuff like that.
segments.cn: 因为显然，鸡尾酒是不同酒精或烈酒与果汁等的组合。

segments.en: So what does a Cosmo have?
That's a good question.
Cosmo is a vodka drink, I believe, and it's served in a Martini glass.
segments.cn: 我相信Cosmo是伏特加饮料，盛在马提尼杯里。

segments.en: But it's generally considered a drink for ladies, for women.
segments.cn: 但通常被认为是女士的饮料。

segments.en: Why is that?
Probably because it's a weaker drink, but also because it's popular in the media and in movies and stuff as a woman's drink.
segments.cn: 可能因为它是一种较弱的饮料，但也因为它在媒体和电影中作为女性饮料而流行。

segments.en: So that's how it got that reputation.
segments.cn: 所以它得到了这样的声誉。

segments.en: I see.
All right, very good.
So that's what a Cosmo is.
Now, if we move on to another very popular drink, a little bit more tropical, I think everyone always has it in the Caribbean or when they're on vacation at the beach.
segments.cn: 现在，如果我们转到另一种非常受欢迎的饮料，更热带一点，我想每个人在加勒比海或度假时总是会喝。

segments.en: It's called a Sex on the Beach.
Okay, this name might make you laugh because Sex on the Beach, it's very descriptive, but it's actually a very common drink.
segments.cn: 好吧，这个名字可能会让你笑，因为Sex on the Beach，非常形象，但实际上是一种非常常见的饮料。

segments.en: And in the dialogue, he talks about how he likes to have this drink served in a pineapple or a coconut.
segments.cn: 在对话中，他提到他喜欢把这饮料放在菠萝或椰子里。

segments.en: So that means it's very fruity.
segments.cn: 这意味着它非常水果味。

segments.en: And I think it's a rum drink, right?
segments.cn: 我想这是一种朗姆酒饮料，对吧？

segments.en: Yeah, and it usually has either coconut juice in it or maybe some pineapple juice.
segments.cn: 是的，通常里面有椰子汁或菠萝汁。

segments.en: Very fruity.
Very fruity.
I think even... I think they add a little bit of vanilla or even ice cream or milk or something like that.
segments.cn: 我想甚至... 我想他们还加一点香草，或者冰淇淋或牛奶之类的东西。

segments.en: So it's very fruity.
It's kind of like a milkshake with liquor.
Weird.
Yeah, I don't know that I've ever had one.
segments.cn: 是的，我不知道我是否喝过。

segments.en: But this is the part of the dialogue where his friend says, Come on, you need to buy something that's more manly.
segments.cn: 但这是对话中他朋友说的部分，来吧，你需要买一些更男人的饮料。

segments.en: He orders a scotch on the rocks instead.
segments.cn: 他点了一杯加冰的苏格兰威士忌。

segments.en: Okay, so a scotch is a type of liquor.
segments.cn: 好吧，苏格兰威士忌是一种烈酒。

segments.en: It's a whiskey.
That's right.
Scotch whiskey comes from Scotland.
segments.cn: 苏格兰威士忌来自苏格兰。

segments.en: And it's a whiskey drink.
And basically scotch on the rocks means scotch poured over ice.
segments.cn: 基本上，苏格兰威士忌加冰意味着苏格兰威士忌倒在冰上。

segments.en: Ice.
So in this case, rocks means ice.
segments.cn: 在这种情况下，rocks指的是冰。

segments.en: And you'll hear this often.
Do you want that on the rocks?
Do you want that on ice?
Right.
So you don't say I want whiskey with ice or you don't say I want scotch with ice.
segments.cn: 所以你不会说我想要加冰的威士忌，或者你不会说我想要加冰的苏格兰威士忌。

segments.en: You can just say on the rocks.
Scotch on the rocks.
So it maybe if you're ordering a rum drink and you don't want it mixed with anything, you can say rum on the rocks.
segments.cn: 所以如果你点一杯朗姆酒饮料而不想混合任何东西，你可以说朗姆酒加冰。

segments.en: On the rocks.
Very good.
And not only are we ordering a scotch on the rocks, but we're also ordering a Manhattan.
segments.cn: 我们不仅点了一杯苏格兰威士忌加冰，还点了一杯曼哈顿。

segments.en: So what does a Manhattan have?
All right.
A Manhattan is a very strong cocktail.
segments.cn: 曼哈顿是一种非常强的鸡尾酒。

segments.en: It has bourbon, which is a kind of whiskey.
segments.cn: 它有波本威士忌，这是一种威士忌。

segments.en: It's an American whiskey.
It has vermouth, which is also a very strong ingredient.
segments.cn: 它有甜味美酒，这也是一种非常强的成分。

segments.en: It has bitters.
What is bitters?
Bitters is another kind of ingredient that is often used in cocktails to make things bitter.
segments.cn: 苦味酒是另一种常用于鸡尾酒的成分，用来增加苦味。

segments.en: Okay, so it's not a sweet drink?
No, no, no, it's not a sweet drink.
Although they sometimes put a little bit of lemon or orange rind in the drink, and that's the skin of the orange.
segments.cn: 虽然他们有时会在饮料中放一点柠檬或橙皮，那是橙子的皮。

segments.en: Okay, so both these drinks are pretty strong.
segments.cn: 好吧，这两种饮料都很强烈。

segments.en: They're very interesting, though.
All the ones that we've seen, the Cosmo, the Sex on the Beach, they're all called cocktails.
segments.cn: 我们看到的所有饮料，Cosmo，Sex on the Beach，都是鸡尾酒。

segments.en: And a cocktail has the characteristic that it usually has alcohol, right?
segments.cn: 鸡尾酒的特点是通常含有酒精，对吧？

segments.en: That's right.
So cocktail is a mix of different ingredients, but is an alcohol based drink.
segments.cn: 所以鸡尾酒是不同成分的混合，但它是基于酒精的饮料。

segments.en: Okay, you can also get non alcoholic cocktails.
segments.cn: 好吧，你也可以点无酒精的鸡尾酒。

segments.en: So there is that option.
All right.
Very good.
So why don't we take a break.
Let's listen to the dialogue again.
And we'll be back in a bit with Fluency Builder.
segments.cn: 我们稍后会回来，继续流利表达。

segments.en: What can I get you?
I'll have a Cosmo, please.
Dude, you can't order a Cosmo.
That's a lady's drink.
You're embarrassing me.
What are you talking about?
It's a good drink.
It's too soft.
Order something with a little more kick to it.
Fine.
I'll have a Sex on the Beach.
segments.cn: 我来一杯Sex on the Beach。

segments.en: You have got to be kidding me.
Come on.
It's delicious, especially when served with a pineapple or a coconut.
segments.cn: 这很好喝，尤其是配上菠萝或椰子。

segments.en: Forget it.
I'm ordering for you.
I'll have a Scotch on the Rocks and my friend here will have a Manhattan.
segments.cn: 我来一杯苏格兰威士忌加冰，我的朋友来一杯曼哈顿。

segments.en: Put it on my tab.
Here.
Now this is a real drink.
segments.cn: 现在这才是真正的饮料。

segments.en: It's strong.
This is going to get me wasted.
That's the idea.
All right, we're back.
So now let's talk a little bit more about these drinks on Fluency Builder.
segments.cn: 现在让我们在流利表达中再多谈谈这些饮料。

segments.en: Fluency Builder.
So Marco, there are many different ways to talk about drinks, but the most important ones that we often discuss, especially with cocktails, is weak drinks versus strong drinks.
segments.cn: 所以Marco，有很多不同的方式来谈论饮料，但我们经常讨论的最重要的，尤其是鸡尾酒，是弱饮料和强饮料。

segments.en: That's right.
Weak drinks versus strong drinks.
Now, usually the Cosmo or maybe the Sex on the Beach, it's considered to be a weak drink.
segments.cn: 通常Cosmo或Sex on the Beach被认为是弱饮料。

segments.en: That's right.
So it's not very strong because there's less alcohol.
segments.cn: 所以它不是很强，因为酒精含量较少。

segments.en: Like a Cosmo has fruit juice, like cranberry juice, and the Sex on the Beach is very fruity.
segments.cn: 像Cosmo有果汁，比如蔓越莓汁，而Sex on the Beach则非常果味。

segments.en: So it makes it less alcohol-y.
segments.cn: 所以它的酒精含量较低。

segments.en: That's right.
And actually, those two also have one type of alcohol.
segments.cn: 其实这两种饮料也只有一种酒精。

segments.en: So it's not very strong.
Whereas maybe a Manhattan has all this mix of bourbon and other drinks as well.
segments.cn: 而曼哈顿可能有波本威士忌和其他饮料的混合。

segments.en: So it will be strong, strong alcoholic drink.
segments.cn: 所以它会是强烈的酒精饮料。

segments.en: Yeah.
And Scotch on the Rocks is also very strong because it's just scotch.
segments.cn: 苏格兰威士忌加冰也很强，因为它只是威士忌。

segments.en: Right.
You're not mixing it with anything.
segments.cn: 你没有和其他东西混合。

segments.en: No, there's just some ice and some scotch.
segments.cn: 不，只有一些冰和威士忌。

segments.en: So that's a strong drink.
OK.
So obviously, his friend was saying that all those drinks are too weak.
segments.cn: 所以显然，他的朋友说所有这些饮料都太弱了。

segments.en: He should order something with a little more kick to it.
segments.cn: 他应该点一些更有劲的饮料。

segments.en: So in this context, kick means strength.
segments.cn: 在这个上下文中，劲意味着力量。

segments.en: So alcohol, he wants a drink that's not weak, that's strong.
segments.cn: 所以酒精，他想要一杯不弱的，强烈的饮料。

segments.en: So a strong drink has more kick than a weak drink.
segments.cn: 所以强饮料比弱饮料更有劲。

segments.en: So can we use this with food or with other situations?
segments.cn: 那我们可以用这个来形容食物或其他情况吗？

segments.en: You can, but with food, it usually means spice.
segments.cn: 可以，但在食物中，通常意味着香料。

segments.en: So Indian food tends to have a lot of kick to it.
segments.cn: 所以印度食物往往很有劲。

segments.en: That means it's very spicy.
OK.
So with alcohol, it's strong.
segments.cn: 所以在酒精中，它是强烈的。

segments.en: With food, it's usually spicy.
segments.cn: 在食物中，通常是辛辣的。

segments.en: If this rice has a kick to it, it means it's a little spicy.
segments.cn: 如果这米饭有劲，意味着它有点辣。

segments.en: That's right.
So just think about kick as meaning that something is strong or has a strong flavor.
segments.cn: 所以只需将劲视为意味着某物强烈或有强烈的味道。

segments.en: OK, very good.
Now, when they were ordering, they didn't pay immediately because she said, put it on my tab.
segments.cn: 现在，当他们点饮料时，他们没有立即付款，因为她说，把它记在我的账上。

segments.en: All right.
So to put something on a tab, this is really important when you're going to a bar or a restaurant and you want to order drinks.
segments.cn: 所以把东西记在账上，这在你去酒吧或餐厅时非常重要，想要点饮料。

segments.en: A tab is a bill that you don't pay immediately.
segments.cn: 账单是你不立即支付的账单。

segments.en: Right.
The bartender will write down all of the drinks that you have and all of their prices and you pay when you leave.
segments.cn: 酒保会记下你喝的所有饮料及其价格，你在离开时付款。

segments.en: OK, so if you put something on your tab, you'll pay it later or when you leave.
segments.cn: 好的，所以如果你把东西记在账上，你会稍后付款或在离开时付款。

segments.en: That's right.
So normally at a bar in America, you say, I want to start a tab.
segments.cn: 所以通常在美国的酒吧，你会说，我想开始一个账单。

segments.en: That means I want to start a bill.
segments.cn: 这意味着我想开始一个账单。

segments.en: And you give the bartender your credit card and he will keep your credit card until you leave.
segments.cn: 然后你把信用卡给酒保，他会在你离开之前保留你的信用卡。

segments.en: Oh, really?
So he keeps your credit card intuitive because obviously maybe you start a tab and then you want to leave and you don't want to pay, then it's a problem.
segments.cn: 所以他保留你的信用卡是因为显然你可能开始一个账单，然后你想离开而不想付款，那就麻烦了。

segments.en: Or people get a little bit drunk and they forget they have to pay.
segments.cn: 或者人们喝得有点醉，忘记了他们必须付款。

segments.en: So bartenders now keep your credit card so that even if you forget to pay, they can charge you.
segments.cn: 所以酒保现在保留你的信用卡，即使你忘记付款，他们也可以收费。

segments.en: Oh, wow.
OK.
Very interesting.
And now for our last phrase, he was a little bit concerned because this drink is so strong.
segments.cn: 现在对于我们的最后一句话，他有点担心，因为这饮料太强了。

segments.en: He said, this is going to get me wasted.
OK, so to be wasted or to get wasted means to get very, very drunk, to drink too much.
segments.cn: 好的，所以喝醉或变得喝醉意味着喝得非常非常多，喝得过量。

segments.en: So if you say I'm wasted, it means I'm very drunk.
segments.cn: 所以如果你说我喝醉了，意味着我喝得很醉。

segments.en: I'm very drunk.
You could say, oh, look at those those boys over there.
segments.cn: 你可以说，哦，看看那边的那些男孩。

segments.en: They're all wasted.
They're all, you know, being drunk and sick.
And yeah.
OK, so it's a very informal, very casual kind of a colloquial way of saying being drunk or being intoxicated.
segments.cn: 好吧，这是一种非常非正式、非常随意的口语方式来表达醉酒或中毒。

segments.en: That's right.
So it's something we often use with friends or as you know, with young people.
segments.cn: 所以我们通常在朋友之间或年轻人中使用。

segments.en: But it's not something you want to use in your English class because it's not a good thing to be.
segments.cn: 但在英语课上不适合使用，因为这不是好事。

segments.en: It's not a good thing to be wasted.
OK, very good.
So now let's take a break and listen to our dialogue one last time and we'll be back to talk a little bit more.
segments.cn: 现在我们休息一下，最后再听一次我们的对话，然后我们会回来再聊一会儿。

segments.en: What can I get you?
I'll have a Cosmo, please.
segments.cn: 我想要一杯宇宙鸡尾酒。

segments.en: Dude, you can't order a Cosmo.
segments.cn: 伙计，你不能点宇宙鸡尾酒。

segments.en: That's a lady's drink.
You're embarrassing me.
What are you talking about?
It's a good drink.
It's too soft.
Order something with a little more kick to it.
Fine.
I'll have a sex on the beach.
segments.cn: 我点一杯海滩上的性爱。

segments.en: You have got to be kidding me.
Come on.
It's delicious, especially when served with a pineapple or a coconut.
segments.cn: 这很好喝，尤其是配上菠萝或椰子。

segments.en: Forget it.
I'm ordering for you.
I'll have a scotch on the rocks and my friend here will have a Manhattan.
segments.cn: 我来一杯威士忌加冰，我的朋友来一杯曼哈顿。

segments.en: Put it on my tab.
Here.
Now, this is a real drink.
segments.cn: 现在，这才是真正的饮料。

segments.en: It's strong.
This is going to get me wasted.
That's the idea.
All right.
So about cocktails, liquors, what is your favorite cocktail when you go out?
segments.cn: 那么关于鸡尾酒和烈酒，你出去时最喜欢的鸡尾酒是什么？

segments.en: I almost always order gin and tonic.
That's my cocktail.
So gin is another type of liquor.
segments.cn: 所以金酒是另一种烈酒。

segments.en: That's right.
Gin is another type of liquor like vodka or whiskey.
segments.cn: 金酒是另一种烈酒，像伏特加或威士忌。

segments.en: It has a very unique taste.
segments.cn: 它有一种非常独特的味道。

segments.en: And tonic is a kind of water, but it has, you know, a certain flavor to it.
segments.cn: 而汤力水是一种水，但它有一定的味道。

segments.en: It has a flavor to it.
So gin and tonic usually has some gin, some tonic water and some lime.
segments.cn: 所以金汤力通常有一些金酒，一些汤力水和一些青柠。

segments.en: But the tonic water is kind of bubbly.
That's right.
It's bubbly.
So that's I like bubbly drinks.
segments.cn: 所以我喜欢有气泡的饮料。

segments.en: So you like champagne and stuff like that.
segments.cn: 所以你喜欢香槟和类似的东西。

segments.en: Exactly.
I see.
What's your favorite?
I am a whiskey guy.
And so I usually order something like this scotch on the rocks or I never like to mix it with anything else.
segments.cn: 所以我通常点像这样威士忌加冰，或者我从不喜欢和其他东西混合。

segments.en: And especially I really don't like having sweet drinks.
segments.cn: 特别是我真的不喜欢甜饮料。

segments.en: So you're a purist?
segments.cn: 所以你是个纯粹主义者？

segments.en: Kind of.
It's just that, you know, when the sweet alcohol and things that are sweet, I don't really think go that well together.
segments.cn: 只是你知道，当甜酒和甜的东西在一起时，我觉得不太搭。

segments.en: No, I think I agree, although there are some sweet alcohols.
segments.cn: 不，我想我同意，尽管有些甜酒。

segments.en: Our Italian friends will be familiar with limoncello, which is that it's a dessert liqueur, which tastes like lemon.
segments.cn: 我们的意大利朋友会熟悉柠檬酒，那是一种甜点酒，味道像柠檬。

segments.en: Or also Kahlua, which is very sweet.
segments.cn: 或者还有卡鲁瓦，非常甜。

segments.en: It's kind of like it's a coffee alcohol, So many people like to put Kahlua in their coffee to have Irish coffee.
segments.cn: 它有点像咖啡酒，很多人喜欢把卡鲁瓦放在咖啡里喝爱尔兰咖啡。

segments.en: That's right.
So actually the alcoholic world is very vast and actually many people don't drink alcohol.
segments.cn: 所以实际上，酒精的世界非常广阔，实际上很多人不喝酒。

segments.en: Many people may have it occasionally.
So, but the other interesting thing is that usually countries have a national alcoholic drink.
segments.cn: 但另一个有趣的事情是，通常国家有一种国家酒。

segments.en: So, for example, the Mexican national alcoholic drink would be Tequila.
segments.cn: 例如，墨西哥的国家酒是龙舌兰。

segments.en: That's right.
Or Russian or Eastern European vodka.
segments.cn: 或者俄罗斯或东欧的伏特加。

segments.en: So, so in your country, maybe you have a local or a national alcoholic drink.
segments.cn: 所以，在你的国家，可能有一种地方或国家的酒。

segments.en: We would be very interested to know about.
That's right.
Let us know.
Our website is EnglishPod.com.
We'll see you guys there.
All right, guys.
See you.
Bye.
